summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a draft letter to preclude cross-examination. The email references an FBI 302 interview report containing information about drug use by two individuals (MV-1 and MV-2) and mentions concerns about MV-1's mental state and family situation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email discussing a draft letter to preclude cross-examination and requesting review of information about MV-1's family.

events.title: Giglio Interview
events.description: An FBI 302 interview was conducted, which contains information about drug use by MV-1 and MV-2.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email discussing a draft legal letter to preclude cross-examination in a case.
It references an FBI 302 interview report from March 23, 2021, containing information about drug use by MV-1 and MV-2.
The email expresses caution about sourcing facts from MV-1, noting she may be mentally ill and reacting to her decision to move away.
The correspondence is between prosecutors in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document shows prosecutors preparing strategy regarding witness credibility and cross-examination limitations.
